title: How to Make a Nerf Holster

steps.headline: Buy a Nerf blaster.
steps.description: Don't destroy the cardboard box it comes in. This will be the material of your holster.

steps.headline: The point of a holster is to carry a gun while not impeding your range of motion.
steps.description: Consequently, a holster for the The Judge may not be the easiest to deal with. A good rule of thumb is that the smaller a blaster is, the better a holster would be, and the larger a blaster is, the better a sling would be.

steps.headline: Disassemble the cardboard packaging by cutting only the tape holding it together.
steps.description: Don't cut the cardboard, because you risk damaging a part you want to use later.

steps.headline: Put the blaster on the now flattened box, preferably on a section with few folds.
steps.description: This is where your own creativity comes in. Try to make a complete circle of cardboard around the main body of the gun.

steps.headline: Cut out this section and tape it together with duct tape.
steps.description:
Trim it so that the cardboard cylinder covers the blaster, but leaves the grip open. steps.headline: Tape another flat piece of cardboard to the bottom of the holster so the gun does not fall through.
Wrap the holster in duct tape to make it stronger.
You can now either tape the holster to a belt/make belt loops or use string to hang around your body.

text:
Buy a Nerf blaster. Don't destroy the cardboard box it comes in. This will be the material of your holster. The point of a holster is to carry a gun while not impeding your range of motion. Consequently, a holster for the The Judge may not be the easiest to deal with. A good rule of thumb is that the smaller a blaster is, the better a holster would be, and the larger a blaster is, the better a sling would be. Disassemble the cardboard packaging by cutting only the tape holding it together. Don't cut the cardboard, because you risk damaging a part you want to use later. Put the blaster on the now flattened box, preferably on a section with few folds. This is where your own creativity comes in. Try to make a complete circle of cardboard around the main body of the gun. Cut out this section and tape it together with duct tape. Trim it so that the cardboard cylinder covers the blaster, but leaves the grip open. The blaster should fit snugly in the holster. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/13\/Make-a-Nerf-Holster-Step-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Nerf-Holster-Step-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/13\/Make-a-Nerf-Holster-Step-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Nerf-Holster-Step-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Tape another flat piece of cardboard to the bottom of the holster so the gun does not fall through. Wrap the holster in duct tape to make it stronger. You can now either tape the holster to a belt/make belt loops or use string to hang around your body.
